TITLE: Claude API Memory System Access Instructions

Claude API Memory System Access Instructions
Problem in one sentence
ChatGPT still can’t browse my memory via the IP or custom headers, so we added clean
HTTPS endpoints that return plain HTML pages with embedded JSON (and simple query-
key auth) at api.nsgia.com. You (Claude) can already reach them reliably. Please use the
steps below.
0) Rules you must follow
- Use HTTPS domain, not IP: always https://api.nsgia.com, never http://104.191…
- No custom headers needed. Auth is a simple query parameter: key=public-read-2025.
- Two endpoints you will use now:
1) /mem/search → find items (returns an HTML page that contains a JSON payload block).
2) /mem/get → open a specific item by id (also an HTML page with a JSON payload block).
1) Health check (sanity)
Open:
https://api.nsgia.com/health
Expect: JSON like {"status":"healthy",...}. If not healthy, stop and report.
2) Search for items (example: “memory”)
Open:
https://api.nsgia.com/mem/search?keyword=memory&limit=5&key=public-read-2025
Expect: HTML page titled 'Search results'. Inside is a <script id="memory_payload"
type="application/json"> block with JSON data.
Extract 'id' values for step 3.
3) Open one item by ID
Use:
https://api.nsgia.com/mem/get?id=PUT-ID-HERE&key=public-read-2025
Expect: HTML page titled 'Entry'. Inside, JSON block with 'content' field.
4) Specific info requests (e.g., 10 Southeast PHA addresses)
1) Run targeted search:
https://api.nsgia.com/mem/search?keyword=PHA&limit=10&key=public-read-2025
2) Open items with /mem/get?id=... and read 'content'.
3) Extract info as needed.
5) Common errors
- 401/403: Ensure key=public-read-2025 is present.
- 404: Check path is exactly /mem/search or /mem/get.
- HTML but 'no data': Parse <script id='memory_payload' ...>.
